column4: hmm. i set xcompmgr to startup with simple drop shadows, then i logged out, then back in, and now my panels are gone
help?
xcompmgr has to be set to autostart when you log in
also it isn't entirely bug free
it was working when it was set up for regular drop shadows =\
so, what is my next plan of action?
if you have it set up for startup remove it
from start up
i can't access any menus
alt-f2 should open up a run menu
how did you set it to run at start up
that was before i logged off, when i had menus
I know but what method did you do to make it run at startup, or if you didn't
http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=73101&postcount=21
i used that
what ubuntu version are you running?
dapper
ok does the alt-f2 open a run dialog?
yes
ok type in gnome-session-manager and if that doesn't work try gnome-session-properties I don't know what it was called in dapper
oh, ok, i got it now travisat , i think i can do it from here
gl
thanks.
also xcompmgr has always been buggy in the session manager you might try a higher order setting, I think if it runs at the wrong time it messes up the panels if I remember right
